fields.description:

The page wich reffer as the home page has the "house" icon, but it dont display automaticly when opening the space.

We have another instance of Confluence working on a 2.7.1 and the problem doesnt appear.
I'm not sure how to reproduce this problem.

So far I can see that is displays the most recent places visited by a user. Starts with 3 items and then builds up as you browse along.
Not clear on limits how far back the entries are etc

fields.description:
User reports when he tries to add bullets or numbering into the panel using the icon in the tool bar (using the rich text field) it removes all the markups in the panel so that when saved and viewed the panel is no longer there. When using the wiki markups or adding the bullets manually, the problem does not occur.

I have not been able to replicate the issue locally.
fields.summary: Bullets break panels within Rich Text Editor
DefaultMultiQueueTaskManager.removeTaskQueue does not remove the task queue, causing problems with Plugins handling queues

fields.description:
The rich text editor does not render macros.  However, it would be extremely helpful to at least render some basic built-in layout macros, such as the {section}, {column}, ... macros.

Currently, displaying (not rendering) these macros is quite intimidating to a novice user, even in cases where only a relatively simple page structure is created with some simple layout macros.
fields.summary: Rich Text Editor should support a basic set of built-in macros, such as {section}, {column}, ...

fields.description:
When editing a page in rich text mode the following sequence of keystrokes makes the editor jump to the top of the page:
- enter
- backspace

This is obviously quite annoying, especially with larger pages.
fields.summary: Enter + Backspace maks Rich Text Editor jump to top of page

fields.description:
This issue relates to the 'Server Base Url' field in the 'General Configuration' section of the 'Administration' screen.

Confluence assumes that the URL that is provided there does NOT end in a slash and always adds an additional slash to it.  This leads to the following effects:

- some URLs provided by Confluence (such as the URL pointing to a newly created personal space) contain a double slash-symbol (e.g. http://confluence.ipcos.local//display/~joris+geysens), but this is not a major issues, since web browsers (or at least Firefox) is immune to such modifications

- the URL used in notification e-mails to point to the CSS to be used to display that e-mail is wrong.  Outlook does not seem to be immune to this double slash begin present in that URL and fails to load the right CSS.  The layout is somewhat messed up.

A simple internal check whether the base URL ends with a slash-symbol or not should suffice to solve this problem.
fields.summary: Adding a slash (/) to the end of the base URL leads to CSS not being correctly loaded in notification e-mails

fields.description: When a custom issue type has been translated, and the translation contains a Swedish char, the icon is not replaced
fields.summary: Add icon mapping does not work if the mapping name contains öäå (umlauts)

fields.description: I accidently copied an entire HTML page into the Custom HTML field. The edit page breaks as a result and I am unable to fix through the Admin panel. Fixing though the database is problematic because I don't have access to the database - and it's not a simple edit even if I did. Have tried accessing this page by both FireFox and IE 6 with the same result. Screenshot attached.
fields.summary: Extra <html> in Custom HTML field breaks Custom HTML edit page

fields.description: Create a News which contains "h1 " header. The line for the header extends into the calendar on the right. This is using the default theme. This  happens on h1 only.
fields.summary: h1. Header Line extends into calendar on a News Page

After clicking the edit/reply link, there isn't any editors shown. This problem happens in IE 6, however, it's working fine in IE 7 and Firefox.

fields.description: The pagetree can take a substantial time to load and take up a large amount of screen real-estate.  It should not automatically open when editing a page, even if it was open the last time a page was edited.
fields.summary: Editing a page should not display the pagetree until the user chooses to edit the page's location.

fields.description:
At present the velocity resource manager will query every configured resource loader for custom space decorators. If one exists it is found in the first resource loader (hibernate) and all is well. For cases where there are no custom decorators (the most common case) the entire resource loader chain is queried every time. This results in approximately four resource queries every page load which will scan through the entire resource loader chain. The final resource loader in the chain, the dynamic plugin resource loader, is quite expensive to query and negative hits are not cached. It also reduces performance on app servers which have slow and synchronized class loaders.

As custom space decorators can only be found in two of the resource loaders, hibernate and the classpath, we should limit scans to these two loaders only.
fields.summary: Space decorators should only be loaded from suitable velocity resource loaders

fields.description:
This only occurs when creating a new page/blog rather than when editing an existing one. Problem is that showMarkup() in page-editor.js hides/shows #sidebar, but in space.vmd (decorator for adding pages) this div wrapper is not used, just a 15% table column.

Space.vmd either needs bringing in line with page.vmd, or page.vmd should be the decorator used when adding pages.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-11817].
  {panel}

This is what it currently looks like:
http://extranet.atlassian.com/plugins/servlet/webdav/Personal/~mtokar/Skitchen/PagePermissions-20080514-115441.jpg

Maybe something like this would be easier to read:

*Page Permissions*
Restrictions from parent pages:

*- Only *someone@xxx.com* can *view* this page.
*- Only *someone@xxx.com* can *view* this page.
*- Only *someone@xxx.com* can *view* this page.

fields.summary: Improve listing of page permissions

fields.description:
The cache labelled "UI Templates" (cache:com.atlassian.confluence.util.ConfluenceVelocityResourceCache) currently has the size of 100. Changing the size of the cache on CAC to 300 showed the increase in the effectiveness of the cache and overall confluence performance. Having the bigger size cache in this case decreases the number of time we need to go through the resource loading code. In resin app server resource loading is very slow and avoiding it improves the performance. 

We should increase the cache size to 300 in our cache  configuration. It would be very beneficial for any app server:
{noformat}
        <local-scheme>
            <scheme-name>cache:com.atlassian.confluence.util.ConfluenceVelocityResourceCache</scheme-name>
            <scheme-ref>default</scheme-ref>
            <high-units>300</high-units>
            <expiry-delay>1800s</expiry-delay>
        </local-scheme>
{noformat}
fields.summary: Improve performance by specifying a larger size for the UI Templates cache

fields.description:
Confluence is doubly escaping ampersands in the link elements of its feeds.  For example:

 <link rel="alternate"
        href="http://extranet.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=702677471&amp;focusedCommentId=702677855#comment-702677855" />

This breaks the link, as the feed reader now displays the link with the &amp; rendered as & instead of the & it should be.  This usually results in the comment not being highlighted.  It also exposes a bug in a number of feed readers, including Thunderbird 2 and 3, Akregator and Liferea Feed Reader, where these messages are unable to be associated with their previous versions of messages, so everytime the feed is downloaded, the entry is duplicated (VERY annoying).
fields.summary: Double escaped ampersands in confluence feeds

fields.description:
Steps to replicate:

1) Set up notifications. You might have to remember to notify yourself on changes (the preference).
2) Add an attachment thru the UI to verify it's working.
3) Add an attachment to the same page using the Remote API.

I used http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFEXT/Confluence+Command+Line+Interface but it's been reported with a different client as well.
fields.summary: Notification is not triggered when attachment added thru Remote API

fields.description:
Our Confluence instance does not allow anonymous access, so all access must be authenticated.

I can connect to a Confluence RSS feed from an external RSS Reader (RssReader) when I authenticate using an internal Confluence account,
but if I attempt to connect to a Confluence RSS feed from RssReader and the Confluence instance is integrated with an LDAP directory, then the authentication fails.

Suggestions?
fields.summary: Cannot authenticate to RSS Feeds when integrated with LDAP directory

fields.description:
Right now screens that come up when customers try to get support or try to update their software when they are out of maintenance only say to contact Atlassian. We would like some kind of call to action so that the customer does not only have the option to contact Atlassian and can instead attempt to renew their software on their own. 

The most important link is the one that will go to the order form. If you would like to include a link to the why renew page that would be awesome too!

   http://www.atlassian.com/software/confluence/learn/whyrenew.jsp

Anytime a customer comes across a screen that is notifying them that their maintenance is up is when they should have the option of using our online order form. It should clearly state that what they are trying to do will require that they update their maintenance and then have a simple link to the order form.
fields.summary: Add links to Order-form and Why-renew-page that notify customers of their expired maintenance
Add support for Atom Publishing Protocol

fields.description:
Confluence still uses DWR 1.1.4. This version contains a Cross Site Scripting Vulnerability in the handling of error messages. Example

/confluence/dwr/exec/AjaxUserProfileEditor.getPreferenceUserEditWysiwyg.dwr?callCount=1&c0-scriptName=AjaxUserProfileEditor&c0-methodName=getPreferenceUsertest&c0-id=');</script>a<script>Evil_Script</script>

Maybe this bug is already known, getahead.org says that "DWR version 2.0.1 and before contained 2 XSS vulnerabilities". Perhaps this is one of them.

Kind regards
Bjoern Froebe
fields.summary: XSS in DWR

Please refer to the attachment for better clarification regarding this issue.
fields.summary: DynamicTaskList version 2 does not work with ampersand (&) symbol
Allow user to modify the limit of pages shown  when viewing pages alphabetically

fields.description:
The MySQL MyISAM storage engine does not support foreign key constraints or transactions. This may cause data corruption and is not recommended for use.

Since its the default storage engine for MySQL Confluence is often installed using it without any warning given to the user.  Confluence will work perfectly until the lack of foreign keys and proper transaction isolation causes data corruption, at which point creating backups or upgrading can be very difficult.

It would be great to detect this storage type during Confluence boot and provide an appropriate message on the user interface and/or in the system logs.
fields.summary: Detect MySQL MyISAM Storage Type and report as Error
Provde Database Analysis Tool

fields.description:
The following code block shows an underscore in the first input_file instance but not the second one. After some experimentation it appears that the last underscore in a code block does not appear properly. A workaround is to put an underscore after your code which will not appear but will make your last real underscore appear. Feels like a CSS bug.

{code}
# For sam:
/data/sympa/bin/sympa.pl --create_list --robot globe.gov --input_file /data/sympa/etc/listcreation.xml

# For theoden:
sympa.pl --create_list --robot theoden.globe.ucar.edu --input_file /path/to/my_file.xml
{code}
fields.summary: Last underscore in a code block doesn't show up

fields.description:
Whilst trying to delete some spam on c.a.com, I found that I could not delete the user:
{code}"jiracom/buy+xanax.+super+cheap+xanax+tablets!" {code}

http://confluence.atlassian.com/admin/users/viewuser.action?username=jiracom%252Fbuy%252Bxanax.%252Bsuper%252Bcheap%252Bxanax%252Btablets%2521

This is due to the '+' signs in the username. The slashes and the exclamations do not cause any problems.

However you cannot create such a user in the browser (pluses are converted to spaces). You can do this through rpc though.
fields.summary: Cannot delete a user with a '+' in the username
link-to: The '@parent' link target is not supported.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-11785].
  {panel}

*Enhancement Description*
Provide a way for the user to access their favorites and bookmarks from any page without having to navigate to another page.

*Use Case*
On my company's wiki, I use two main methods to navigate to pages I deal with on a daily basis:
# My list of favorites, viewable on the Dashboard
# Drilling down from the main page of the space I am interested in until I get to the page I am looking for (and if I deal with it daily I am going to be adding it as a favorite so I can skip this process in the future)

Based on the fact that my favorites are essentially a list of bookmarks that I want to visit no matter where I am on the Internet or browsing the rest of the wiki, having to go back to the Dashboard is an extra step that is unnecessary/undesired.
fields.summary: Favorites/Bookmarks Visible on Every Page

fields.description:
Borders of table cells are not rendered in the PDF export. Only borders for table header cells.

||Border for this cell is rendered|Border for this cell is not rendered|

It has worked fine in previous releases. (e.g. 2.7.2)

See attached image for an example.
fields.summary: PDF Export failes to render table cells

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-11782].
  {panel}

As of now the usage tracking plugin (bundled) is storing all the indexed content of events in a single place. What if it grow along with the time.... imagine the size of the folder. 

Alternate design.... what one can try to code is as follows:

Categorize the usage tracking indexed content in separate folders as per the month wise. it goes like this
Current month content will be in usual place where u were maintaining it now. once the month get over move the indexed content to some backup directory and start fresh index for the next month. While showing the statistics you can read the current month content from the current usual folder and for previous month one can read content from the folders placed in backup directory. such that u need not to worry even if index corrupted for the current month atleast.
fields.summary: Improvements in UsageTracking indexing functionality

fields.description:
If there is a ' (*double-byte single quotation mark*) in the filename, you are unable to edit or remove the attachment. If you remove the ' character, then the file is handled ok, even if the name contains Japanese characters.

This issue has also been reproduced when umlauts are present in the file name.
fields.summary: Confluence not able to handle attachments with non-ascii character in the filename

fields.summary: 404 / Page not found page got dumber
PDF export does not render panel macro background-color or title alignment

fields.description:
If Confluence is set up without a context path, there will be a performance impact from requests being served for spacer.gif.  This is a particularly large problem when the clients using Confluence are Internet Explorer 6.

The primary problem is that the requests use the wrong URL and hit the (slightly expensive) 404 page:

"GET /display/CONFEXT/undefined/images/border/spacer.gif HTTP/1.1" 404 40448 196468

That's 40 KB download in a response that took 196 ms to generate. By contrast, a 200 response for this file serves 43 bytes in 2 ms and also gets caching headers returned so subsequent requests get a 304 response.

"GET /images/border/spacer.gif HTTP/1.1" 200 43 1632

The other related problem is that IE6 clients request this resource once per comment on a page, rather than once for the whole page.
fields.summary: IE6 clients download spacer.gif from wrong URL many times

fields.description:
I click Edit and nothing happens when I try and edit the page restrictions. 

I'm on Firefox for Mac. Also happens on Firefox for Windows.
fields.summary: Cannot edit page restrictions in Personal space

fields.description:
A user just added a comment to one of our pages, and they evidently have chosen german as their language since the email notification that I received had german link descriptions (see below)

{quote}
Page commented by Christian Spröte

I havent't had the chance to test Builder 3.1 yet - is it possible to create a menulink to the "Add Bookmark" screen now?
In reply to a comment by Alain Moran :

Ooops .. i just checked .. it is one of the webui aliases* for the social bookmarking plugin ... do you have that plugin installed?

    * - the aliases are not really menulinks at all but a list of location & key values that simplify access to other plugins webui links. In Builder 3.1 we expect to pull this out of the code and make it dynamic, allowing you to setup aliases to any plugin/url, as well as giving greater transparency in what is really going on.

Benachrichtigungseinstellungen aufheben oder bearbeiten
View Online | Antworten 
{quote}


Ideally all notficiations should be sent in the language of the target user rather than the sender
fields.summary: Notfications are sent out using incorrect language pack

fields.description:
The Attachment Checkout plugin will not be ported to Confluence 2.7 or above by it's supporters.  The checkout feature would help us immensely here at Univ. of Michigan Health System.  I am requesting Atlassian take this feature on and incorporate it into Confluence mainstream development.

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFEXT/Attachment+Checkout+Plugin
fields.summary: Support Attachment Checkout Plugin

fields.description:
Corporate users adoption of the Wiki is slowed due to the complexity of importing graphics into their new page content.  It is difficult to pull them away from Microsoft Word when they can just cut and paste graphics. Explaining the finer points of creating a .gif or .jpg puts some people off.

I would love to see a screen capture tool added to the 'image properties' form.   In addition to the "Browse" and "Attach" button, there could be a "Capture" button.  An example of functionality would be as follows...
1.  User clicks the "Insert/Edit Image" button from the Page Edit view.
2.  From the "Image Properties" form they click a "Capture" button.
3.  A pop-up form informs them that after they click OK, they should find get the image they want on their screen, Press F11 (which produces a cross-hair mouse display), and then click the two oppsing corners of the image they wish to import.
4.  On the 2nd mouse click (corner), they are returned to "Image Properties" form, where they can specify the filename they want and the file type (.jpg or .gif).
5.  Confluence does the file conversion and saves the image.
6.  Now the user can attach the image.
fields.summary: Add Screen Capture selection to Insert/Edit Image

fields.description: In one of my spaces (actually the only space that has templates), all 3 templates suddenly became empty.  On the "Page Template Wizard" page, the templates are still listed but the Description field says "$template.description" instead.  You can still select the template but there's nothing in it.  The global templates still work.
fields.summary: Space templates suddenly become blank

fields.description:
Upgrade task failed when trying to upgrade from Confluence version 2.2.9 to Confluence version 2.8:
{noformat}
2008-05-08 16:57:17,109 INFO [main] [atlassian.confluence.upgrade.MoveBandanaConfigsToDatabaseUpgradeTask] doUpgrade Starting Bandana configuration migration
2008-05-08 16:57:17,296 ERROR [main] [com.atlassian.upgrade.AbstractUpgradeManager] doUpgrade Upgrade failed: com.atlassian.confluence.extra.leftnavigation.LeftNavSettings : com.atlassian.confluence.extra.leftnavigation.LeftNavSettings
{noformat}

Accessing Confluence via browser leads to an error page as shown in screenshot, error.jpg.

It occurs when one of the space in Confluence instance 2.2.9 is using the Left Navigation theme and the theme has been configured via the "Configure theme" session.

A workaround would be to perform an incremental upgrade. For example, first upgrade the Confluence instance from version 2.2.9 to 2.7.x. Confirm the upgrade process is successful and later perform an upgrade again from version 2.7.x to version 2.8.0.
fields.summary: Configured Left Navigation theme leads to "doUpgrade failed" when upgrading Confluence 2.2.x to Confluence 2.8

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-11766].
  {panel}

The tanuki wrapper used for the 2.8.0 installer produces some additional logging when the application is run in a terminal. A customer has raised a good point of this logging flooding the screen and potentially hiding and nasty errors that could appear - the errors would only really be noticed if they periodically check the logs or Confluence itself crashes. Example of the ping request and response, sent every few seconds:

{noformat}
INFO   | jvm 1    | 2008/04/28 20:08:05 | Received a packet PING : ping
INFO   | jvm 1    | 2008/04/28 20:08:05 | Send a packet PING : ok
DEBUG  | wrapperp | 2008/04/28 20:08:05 | read a packet PING : ok
DEBUG  | wrapper  | 2008/04/28 20:08:05 | Got ping response from JVM
DEBUG  | wrapperp | 2008/04/28 20:08:09 | send a packet PING : ping
INFO   | jvm 1    | 2008/04/28 20:08:09 | Received a packet PING : ping
INFO   | jvm 1    | 2008/04/28 20:08:09 | Send a packet PING : ok
DEBUG  | wrapperp | 2008/04/28 20:08:09 | read a packet PING : ok
DEBUG  | wrapper  | 2008/04/28 20:08:09 | Got ping response from JVM
DEBUG  | wrapperp | 2008/04/28 20:08:13 | send a packet PING : ping
INFO   | jvm 1    | 2008/04/28 20:08:13 | Received a packet PING : ping
INFO   | jvm 1    | 2008/04/28 20:08:13 | Send a packet PING : ok
DEBUG  | wrapperp | 2008/04/28 20:08:13 | read a packet PING : ok
DEBUG  | wrapper  | 2008/04/28 20:08:13 | Got ping response from JVM
DEBUG  | wrapperp | 2008/04/28 20:08:17 | send a packet PING : ping
INFO   | jvm 1    | 2008/04/28 20:08:18 | Received a packet PING : ping

"unable to find resource" error logged during an export

fields.description:
When I edit a page and insert a link using the RTE for the first time it renders the link in wiki markup.

Please see the screen recording attached.

Cheers

Matt
fields.summary: Link displayed in wiki markup in RTE

fields.description:
Can we please ensure that Confluence is supported for use with DB2 9.

More information:

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Known+Issues+for+DB2?focusedCommentId=155813478#comment-155813478
http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-11125
fields.summary: Support for DB2 9

fields.summary: If directories associated with Confluence do not allow adding of users or groups, an UnsupportedOperationException is thrown

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-11758].
  {panel}

Originally created as request for metadata plugin enhancement and the developer suggested I request this from confluence instead.

We use confluence and metadata for more detailed planning and collaboration of issues that we track in Jira. It would be very nice to have metadata fields in the wiki captured from jira fields from the related issue in Jira. For example, I have an issue in Jira with a priority number attached to it. In the wiki I would want to define a piece of metadata such as: {metadata-jira:Priority}PM-32{metadata-jira}

and this would resolve the metadata to the priority field for the issue PM-32 in my configured Jira instance. I would then be able to reference this piece of metadata in metadata reports and charts.

Hi Ken,

I don't want to add JIRA support to the Metadata Plugin, because that opens the floodgates to similar integration requests with other applications out there. Instead I suggest that you request that Confluence create a new JIRA macro that can give you back data about any project. You can then use this macro as metadata as you describe.

e.g something like:
{metadata-value:Priority}{jira-value:priority|issue=PM-32}{metadata-value}

Note that this requires that the jira-value macro knows how to access your JIRA instance. For example, the jira-issues macro requires that you pass that information every time. Anyway, that is something for the Confluence and JIRA teams to agree upon.

If you agree with this approach, then I will close this issue.

Thanks,

    * Andy

fields.description: The static cached URLs (/s/*) include a counter so that the URLs map to a single piece of content that never changes. The combined.css file uses a space-specific counter for some global resources, making the caching of these resources less optimal.

fields.description:
<confluence-home>/fonts/fop.xml file contains an absolute reference to the font file.  Therefore if the home directory is relocated the uploaded fonts fail, and a stacktrace is created when a pdf export is attempted.

I assume that this also means the fonts are specific to each node of a cluster.
fields.summary: Uploaded pdf fonts break when the home directory is moved.

fields.description: We have an evergrowing spam problem, and we need a few ways to facilitate easy manual removal. This is just one of them. This should probably only be available to administrators, but it depends on how nice/ugly the UI looks.

fields.description: The \{jiraissues} macro counter at the top of the results, or displayed using the "count" option shows however many issues are available to display. So if the total number of issues is greater than your JIRA "tempMax", you get a completely misleading number.
fields.summary: "Count" option on jiraissues macro shows how many issues are displayed, not how many are available.

fields.description:
Screenshots and instructions at http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFEXT/Dynamic+Tasklist+2 are incorrect or really out of date. E.g.:
*"{tasklist:My Tasklist Title}" does not produce anything similar to what is depicted. There is no place to add or sort tasks in the resulting markup.
*The example task list under Manual Editing doesn't format into anything sensible after saving the document.

I put critical because this extension is not usable with this documentation.
fields.summary: Dynamic Tasklist 2 documentation is unusuable

fields.description:
When removing user that has content associated with his/her username, you will obtain following output listing the space name where that user has contributed by adding content.
Searching for that particular piece of content is not that easy. 
My suggestion is: When fetching the content associated with a username, make it possible to conveniently access that content via links or give a specific {{Space > page}} or {{Page > Comment}} links to get to it.

{noformat} 
The following error(s) occurred:

    * This user can not be removed

« Return to view user: xyz@xyz.com

XYZ can not be removed because he or she has authored content in one or more spaces.
The user has commented in the following spaces:

    * Confluence Extension
{noformat}
fields.summary: Show links to content still associated with a user after removal

fields.description:
When accessing the resources directory is accessed and +symlinked+ all the space abbreviations to that directory, like such:

{{ln -s ops .}}

...for all spaces.

bq. Your backup script isn't smart enough to know the difference between a symlink to a directory and a real directory. It treated the symlinks as subdirectories. It ate up lots of processor and kept creating infinitely-nested subdirectories until all the partition's space or inodes were eaten up. Removing the symlinks and cleaning up the backup's temp files cleaned up the mess. Obviously, this could lead to Very Bad Things. Please make the backup script symlink aware to help other
fields.summary: Backup Script Doesn't Differentiate Between Symlinks and Real Sub-directories
Provide a proper 3-way merge tool for edit conflicts.
Explanation for the favourite pages on dashboard should be improved
